file_content.text: My name stays gone.
Of course, who else would come?
So my "untraceable" engine only bought time. That's fair. I'm Stark. I've gained so much from your Senator.
Grell's of no further use to you. Let him go.
Release him.
Why would you want him now?
You kidnapped Grell, tortured him--why?
Why did you do this?
Because I was told to.
You're about to lose it all.
I do exist on a whim, just not yours.
Father, get up. We came to save you!
He's not there. He didn't take my questions well.
I learned a lot. About an Esh-kha horde in a prison. The First Son will want that.
Tell me what the First Son's real name is.
Who is the First Son?
I'm not good with names, since I lost mine.
With Grell's knowledge, the First Son would have time to build his defenses.
This could cost us the war.
Bravo, Jedi.
I've been hoping to encounter another Child of the Emperor.
You're one of the Children.
No, I'm... I was allowed this memory.
I was once a great Sith. But I looked into the abyss. I followed the Children, and the First Son found out.
The scalpel and bright lights took my name. Now I serve, as Stark.
Stop it! Stop talking! You hurt my father, you don't deserve to live!
This "Stark" could give us a wealth of information.
We should take him prisoner.
Oh. I wouldn't like that.
Don't get upset.
Don't tell me to calm down!
I was ordered to study you, Jedi. Combat techniques, disposition, history. You're interesting.
Even as a child, you were so very special.
You're studious, like me. Learning, learning.
All those travels, always being the outsider.
We can't risk him reporting back to the First Son.
Agreed. He knows too much.
Interfering in my duties is rude.
If I kill you, I might earn my name back.
